export_format.description: CSV export from the Report Results page. Data fields are configurable by end users. No further detail provided about file structure or packaging.

documentation.description: A single paragraph on a Drupal web page. No data dictionary, no field definitions, no schema, no downloadable documentation artifacts. The paragraph describes the export mechanism (CSV from Report Results page) but provides zero detail about data content.

clinical.evidence: These are patient privacy monitoring / access auditing products, not clinical EHR systems. No clinical data tables or fields documented.

secure_messages.evidence: No mention of messages, inbox, communication, or portal in the b(10) documentation.

billing_financial.evidence: No mention of billing, charges, claims, or payments. Not applicable to these audit/monitoring products.

insurance_coverage.evidence: No mention of insurance, coverage, or payer data. Not applicable to these audit/monitoring products.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: No mention of appointments or scheduling. Not applicable to these audit/monitoring products.

documents_images.evidence: No mention of documents, images, or attachments.

audit_trails.evidence: The products (FairWarning, Access Intelligence, Digital Identity Intelligence) ARE audit/access monitoring tools. The documentation mentions 'EHI data sources' and 'Report Results page' which likely contain access logs, user activity, and audit trail data. However, no specific fields or tables are documented.

issues: Extremely minimal documentation — a single paragraph with no data dictionary, schema, or field definitions
No downloadable documentation artifacts (no PDF, ZIP, or other files)
No description of what data domains or fields are included in the export
Says 'Data fields included in the export capabilities are configurable by end users' but doesn't list what fields are available
Single shared b(10) paragraph covers all four certified products with no differentiation
Does not meet the spirit of 170.315(b)(10) documentation requirements — provides no information about what EHI is actually exported
summary: Imprivata's EHI export documentation consists of a single paragraph on their ONC certification disclosures page stating that users can export EHI in CSV format from the Report Results page, with configurable data fields governed by user roles. No data dictionary, field definitions, schema, or sample exports are provided. These products (Access Intelligence, Digital Identity Intelligence, FairWarning) are patient privacy monitoring and access auditing tools — not traditional clinical EHR systems — so their EHI is primarily audit/access log data rather than clinical records. The documentation is among the most minimal b(10) disclosures observed.
